channel.title: Virus Protection - Help Needed!
channel.description:
Right, so I have Norton Internet Security 2007 which is good, it has detected every single virus/keylogger etc. that I've ever had and I did a HP Full System Recovery and when I try to install NIS 2007, it says that I have installed it too many times using the same Product Key. So, basically I am no longer immune to viruses and keyloggers etc. so please can someone tell me some FREE virus protection programmes. I could always buy a new Product Key but it costs $49.99 which is roughly £40.00 (I'm not good with currency so I'm probably miles out) So, again... Please could someone tell me the name of a FREE virus protection programme that automatically detects viruses and keyloggers etc. Thanks for reading. Your suggestions are greatly appreciated. ;D
EDIT: Someone view already... Jeez...

item.title: Virus Protection - Help Needed!

item.description:
@Heaven wrote:

One word-
warez-bb.

I use NOD32

item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

paying for anti virus is good? because programmers spend hours making programs to live in are community to pay taxes and etc,. and i understand ripping of cinmea 4d (too high prices!) but in adobe photoshop, again, should be $200 still its $700
and virus software is $50 to pretty much not have to buy another computer and some last for 3 years

item.title: Virus Protection - Help Needed!
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

mcafee goes after norton, is sucks.

Hmm… My friend uses Avira…

His computer froze from 60 pop up messages, and avira had to detect all of them and block them.
Without avira he would have to restart his comp, avira cleared the freezing.
Dunno bout you, but I think it’s pretty good, even though I havn’t really used it yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus Protection - Help Needed!

item.description:

Norton Internet Security 2007 which is good
[/quote]You fail. Use AVG/Kaspersky or something, do you seriously pay for antivirus?[/quote]
^
Norton fails, fyi.
I had norton, and had several Trojan’s on it.
Which it didn’t pick up.
